title: How to Sew a Scented Shoe Stuffer

steps.headline: Draw a template from which to cut your fabric.
steps.description: The shape should be a little like a solid cream deodorant container - rectangular with a curved edge. See the photo for the shape.

steps.headline: Cut out the fabric shapes following your template.
steps.description: You will need to cut four shapes to make a pair of shoe stuffers.

steps.headline: Place the right sides facing together, with the raw edges evenly matched.
steps.description: Stitch the pairs together around the curved edge. Clip seams. Turn and press. Turn the edge under a small way and stitch sides.

steps.headline: Trim the unsewn top edge with lace or braid if you like.
Fill the shoe stuffers with a layer of polyester stuffing, a layer of dried, scented flower, another layer of polyester stuffing and so on until the bag is almost full to the top.
Leave enough space to tie a ribbon bow and have a small top knot on the bag.
Put the stuffers into shoes sitting in your closet to keep them fresh and odour-free.
